match.title: 1st ODI

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 13.30 start, First Session 13.30-17.00, Interval 17.00-17.45, Second Session 17.45-21.15

otherSerieses.name: New Zealand in Bangladesh ODI Series

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c †BB McCullum b Neesham 90 (98b 8x4 2x6 144m) SR: 91.83

dismissalComment.html: slower ball sees the end of the home skipper ten short of a ton after a well-constructed knock, he tried to slice it fine but it bounced a touch and took the edge through to his counterpart behind the stumps

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball spells the demise of a Bangladeshi batsman as Naeem is too early into a heave on off and gets a thick edge through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: slower ball sees the end of the home skipper ten short of a ton after a well-constructed knock, he tried to slice it fine but it bounced a touch and took the edge through to his counterpart behind the stumps
superb yorker sees New Zealand and Neesham grab two scalps in this over after several overs without reward, it quickly scuttled under Nasir's bat and there was little the batsman could do about that
another slower ball reaps a wicket as Neesham puts it full outside off, Mahmudullah looks to chop it away but top edges a dolly to Taylor at third man
Mashrafe skies a slog high into the sky and Nathan McCullum settles under it at long-on as Bangladesh are in danger of not batting their overs
this time he beats the bat and hits pad in front of the stumps! Again gets it to swing back and strike on middle and leg, umpire was confident in raising the gfinger
lovely delivery on off which just seamed away a touch and again the bounce undid the batsman as he pushed forward and it struck high on the splice and carried nicely to second slip

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball spells the demise of a Bangladeshi batsman as Naeem is too early into a heave on off and gets a thick edge through to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Southee 5 (8b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: this time he beats the bat and hits pad in front of the stumps! Again gets it to swing back and strike on middle and leg, umpire was confident in raising the gfinger

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque run out (Anderson/McClenaghan) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: firmly drives down to mid-off who dives well to cut it off, in the meantime the batsmen have had a colossal collapse in communication, Anamul set off with the shot, Mominul initially moved forward, then he started to run but Anamul decided to turn around at the same time and they both ended up at the striker's end as the bowler whips the bails off, Anamul reached the crease first so Mominul departs for a diamond duck

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c NL McCullum b Southee 13 (22b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery on off which just seamed away a touch and again the bounce undid the batsman as he pushed forward and it struck high on the splice and carried nicely to second slip

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c †BB McCullum b Anderson 12 (8b 2x4 0x6 10m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: shortish slower ball outside off, Razzak moves across to pull, strikes the thigh pad and balloons up behind the wicket as they set off, Brendon McCullum puts in a superlative dive to pull off a great catch, the only issue being there was no contact with bat or glove as the umpire nevertheless sends the batsman packing

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 71 (77b 6x4 2x6 119m) SR: 92.2

dismissalComment.html: fuller ball on the off stump. Elliot lofts and how fitting is it that Mashrafe takes the catch, a brilliant catch, as his record is the one that Rubel equals for the best figures by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant spell by Rubel, five wickets in it

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson b Rubel Hossain 46 (31b 3x4 4x6 31m) SR: 148.38

dismissalComment.html: what a wicket! Anderson is looking for one shot too many as he is foxed by the slower one on the leg stump. Anderson swings and is half way into his follow through by the time the ball crashes onto the middle stump. Is this the breakthrough that Bangladesh were looking for?

good length ball pitching on the middle stump and moving away. Taylor is looking to steer it and gets an outside edge. Rahim accepts it with glee as he knows that Taylor can take the game away from them quickly. Rubel, like Mahmudullah and Gazi strikes early

what a wicket! Anderson is looking for one shot too many as he is foxed by the slower one on the leg stump. Anderson swings and is half way into his follow through by the time the ball crashes onto the middle stump. Is this the breakthrough that Bangladesh were looking for?

is that the game for Bangladesh? Rubel has certainly turned it around for them. He bowls what seems an innocous delivery, but the ball rushes to him and McCullum slices  straight into the waiting hands of the fielder at backward point

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's a hat-trick for Rubel! This is as lucky as anyone can get as he bowls one down the leg side and Neesham tries to flick it and gets a faint edge back to the keeper. Rahim does well to dive to his right and take a brilliant catch. That's effectively game over for New Zealand

Rubel does have his fifth! McCullum looks to wield the long handle and clears the front foot. He lofts it and it doesn't clear the fielder at mid-off. This has to be right up there as the best spell by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant bowling as he has run through the middle order and the lower middle order of New Zealand

fuller ball on the off stump. Elliot lofts and how fitting is it that Mashrafe takes the catch, a brilliant catch, as his record is the one that Rubel equals for the best figures by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant spell by Rubel, five wickets in it

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the first wicket! Gazi bowls it outside the off stump, enough to have Rutherford swinging after it. He misses and the ball comes in with the angle and hits the leg stump and the collective noise at the ground raises by at least 1000 decibels

dismissalText.commentary: Hamish Rutherford b Sohag Gazi 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: that's the first wicket! Gazi bowls it outside the off stump, enough to have Rutherford swinging after it. He misses and the ball comes in with the angle and hits the leg stump and the collective noise at the ground raises by at least 1000 decibels

dismissalText.commentary: Anton Devcich b Mahmudullah 22 (29b 4x4 0x6 44m) SR: 75.86

dismissalComment.html: good length ball on the off stump. Devcich, after playing all those delightful strokes on the off side tries to get ugly by looking to slog across the line and is beaten. Pretty similar dismissal to Rutherford. The crowd rise up in unison

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 21m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: good length ball pitching on the middle stump and moving away. Taylor is looking to steer it and gets an outside edge. Rahim accepts it with glee as he knows that Taylor can take the game away from them quickly. Rubel, like Mahmudullah and Gazi strikes early

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson b Rubel Hossain 46 (31b 3x4 4x6 31m) SR: 148.38

dismissalComment.html: what a wicket! Anderson is looking for one shot too many as he is foxed by the slower one on the leg stump. Anderson swings and is half way into his follow through by the time the ball crashes onto the middle stump. Is this the breakthrough that Bangladesh were looking for?

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Rubel Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: is that the game for Bangladesh? Rubel has certainly turned it around for them. He bowls what seems an innocous delivery, but the ball rushes to him and McCullum slices  straight into the waiting hands of the fielder at backward point

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's a hat-trick for Rubel! This is as lucky as anyone can get as he bowls one down the leg side and Neesham tries to flick it and gets a faint edge back to the keeper. Rahim does well to dive to his right and take a brilliant catch. That's effectively game over for New Zealand

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Nathan McCullum c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 10 (15b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Rubel does have his fifth! McCullum looks to wield the long handle and clears the front foot. He lofts it and it doesn't clear the fielder at mid-off. This has to be right up there as the best spell by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant bowling as he has run through the middle order and the lower middle order of New Zealand

dismissalText.long: c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: short ball on the leg stump. Southee, under pressure to get going from ball one pulls and finds the fielder at deep midwicket.

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 71 (77b 6x4 2x6 119m) SR: 92.2

dismissalComment.html: fuller ball on the off stump. Elliot lofts and how fitting is it that Mashrafe takes the catch, a brilliant catch, as his record is the one that Rubel equals for the best figures by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant spell by Rubel, five wickets in it

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 71 (77b 6x4 2x6 119m) SR: 92.2

commentTextItems.html: fuller ball on the off stump. Elliot lofts and how fitting is it that Mashrafe takes the catch, a brilliant catch, as his record is the one that Rubel equals for the best figures by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant spell by Rubel, five wickets in it

commentPostTextItems.html: Williamson won't come out to bat as he has injured his thumb and isn't in a position to come and bat. How many of you expected this turnaround after Corey Anderson started to wield the long handle after the rain break?
His spell after the break read 3.5-0-10-5 and that hat-trick. If that doesn't happen to be among the best spells by a Bangladesh bowler, I don't know what would be

McCullum, New Zealand captain, says, "We were in for a good game of cricket. Bangladesh recovered well after being three down through a good partnership. Getting a hat-trick is an achievement. Rubel was outstanding. We have two games to go in the series and we need to win them to win the series. We allowed them, Rahim and Naeem, to get away and get that partnership going. Our middle order didn't contribute today"

Rahim, Bangladesh captain, says, " I thought the wicket was tricky and it wasn't coming on to the bat. All credit to Naeem who came in and performed straightaway. Rubel was amazing. I would like to dedicate the win to Sheikh Salahuddin and his family members"
Rubel Hossain, expectedly, is the Man of the match. We can't publish what he is saying as he is speaking in Bengali.
Thanks for all your comments today and join us day after for the second ODI. Till then it's a good night from all of us here

commentTextItems.html: comes forward and turns it  to square-leg for a single
lofts it to long-on for a single
slower and fuller outside the off stump. He looks to slog it and is beaten
retains the strike with a push to the leg side

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: flighted ball on the middle stump. Elliot lofts it over deep mid wicket for his second six

dismissalText.long: c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: short ball on the leg stump. Southee, under pressure to get going from ball one pulls and finds the fielder at deep midwicket.
slices it to deep point for a single
short ball on the leg stump. That's a gift by Razzak. Elliot pulls it to deep square-leg for a boundary
comes forward and pulls it to deep mid wicket for a  single

commentTextItems.html: Rubel does have his fifth! McCullum looks to wield the long handle and clears the front foot. He lofts it and it doesn't clear the fielder at mid-off. This has to be right up there as the best spell by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant bowling as he has run through the middle order and the lower middle order of New Zealand
comes forward and drives it to long-on for a couple
good length ball outside the off stump. Nathan swings and misses, once again
comes down the track and lofts it to long-on for a couple
lofts it to long-off for a single
fuller ball outside the off stump. McCullum swings. If he got the bat on the ball, it would have sailed over deep mid wicket. He was beaten by the turn

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Southee 5 (8b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: this time he beats the bat and hits pad in front of the stumps! Again gets it to swing back and strike on middle and leg, umpire was confident in raising the gfinger

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque run out (Anderson/McClenaghan) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: firmly drives down to mid-off who dives well to cut it off, in the meantime the batsmen have had a colossal collapse in communication, Anamul set off with the shot, Mominul initially moved forward, then he started to run but Anamul decided to turn around at the same time and they both ended up at the striker's end as the bowler whips the bails off, Anamul reached the crease first so Mominul departs for a diamond duck

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c NL McCullum b Southee 13 (22b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery on off which just seamed away a touch and again the bounce undid the batsman as he pushed forward and it struck high on the splice and carried nicely to second slip

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c †BB McCullum b Neesham 90 (98b 8x4 2x6 144m) SR: 91.83

dismissalComment.html: slower ball sees the end of the home skipper ten short of a ton after a well-constructed knock, he tried to slice it fine but it bounced a touch and took the edge through to his counterpart behind the stumps

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Neesham 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: superb yorker sees New Zealand and Neesham grab two scalps in this over after several overs without reward, it quickly scuttled under Nasir's bat and there was little the batsman could do about that

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam c †BB McCullum b Southee 84 (115b 12x4 0x6 166m) SR: 73.04

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball spells the demise of a Bangladeshi batsman as Naeem is too early into a heave on off and gets a thick edge through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Taylor b Neesham 29 (30b 2x4 1x6 45m) SR: 96.66

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball reaps a wicket as Neesham puts it full outside off, Mahmudullah looks to chop it away but top edges a dolly to Taylor at third man

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c †BB McCullum b Anderson 6 (10b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: moves across to off for the scoop and one-hands it high in the air without any distance as Brendon McCullum settles his gloves underneath it

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c NL McCullum b Neesham 6 (4b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe skies a slog high into the sky and Nathan McCullum settles under it at long-on as Bangladesh are in danger of not batting their overs

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c †BB McCullum b Anderson 12 (8b 2x4 0x6 10m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: shortish slower ball outside off, Razzak moves across to pull, strikes the thigh pad and balloons up behind the wicket as they set off, Brendon McCullum puts in a superlative dive to pull off a great catch, the only issue being there was no contact with bat or glove as the umpire nevertheless sends the batsman packing

headshotImage.caption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamish Rutherford player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamish Rutherford b Sohag Gazi 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: that's the first wicket! Gazi bowls it outside the off stump, enough to have Rutherford swinging after it. He misses and the ball comes in with the angle and hits the leg stump and the collective noise at the ground raises by at least 1000 decibels

dismissalText.commentary: Anton Devcich b Mahmudullah 22 (29b 4x4 0x6 44m) SR: 75.86

dismissalComment.html: good length ball on the off stump. Devcich, after playing all those delightful strokes on the off side tries to get ugly by looking to slog across the line and is beaten. Pretty similar dismissal to Rutherford. The crowd rise up in unison

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 71 (77b 6x4 2x6 119m) SR: 92.2

dismissalComment.html: fuller ball on the off stump. Elliot lofts and how fitting is it that Mashrafe takes the catch, a brilliant catch, as his record is the one that Rubel equals for the best figures by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant spell by Rubel, five wickets in it

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 8 (14b 2x4 0x6 21m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: good length ball pitching on the middle stump and moving away. Taylor is looking to steer it and gets an outside edge. Rahim accepts it with glee as he knows that Taylor can take the game away from them quickly. Rubel, like Mahmudullah and Gazi strikes early

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson b Rubel Hossain 46 (31b 3x4 4x6 31m) SR: 148.38

dismissalComment.html: what a wicket! Anderson is looking for one shot too many as he is foxed by the slower one on the leg stump. Anderson swings and is half way into his follow through by the time the ball crashes onto the middle stump. Is this the breakthrough that Bangladesh were looking for?

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Rubel Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: is that the game for Bangladesh? Rubel has certainly turned it around for them. He bowls what seems an innocous delivery, but the ball rushes to him and McCullum slices  straight into the waiting hands of the fielder at backward point

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's a hat-trick for Rubel! This is as lucky as anyone can get as he bowls one down the leg side and Neesham tries to flick it and gets a faint edge back to the keeper. Rahim does well to dive to his right and take a brilliant catch. That's effectively game over for New Zealand

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Nathan McCullum c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 10 (15b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Rubel does have his fifth! McCullum looks to wield the long handle and clears the front foot. He lofts it and it doesn't clear the fielder at mid-off. This has to be right up there as the best spell by a Bangladesh bowler. Brilliant bowling as he has run through the middle order and the lower middle order of New Zealand

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c sub (Shamsur Rahman) b Abdur Razzak 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: short ball on the leg stump. Southee, under pressure to get going from ball one pulls and finds the fielder at deep midwicket.

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell McClenaghan not out 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 100
absent hurt

notes: Bangladesh innings
First Power Play: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (34 runs, 2 wickets)
Drinks: 48/3 in 14.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 23, Naeem Islam 1)
50 runs in 14.3 overs (88 balls), Extras 6
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 72 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 37, Naeem Islam 12, Ex 3)
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 53 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
100 runs in 22.5 overs (138 balls), Extras 8
4th Wicket: 100 runs in 121 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 64, Naeem Islam 32, Ex 4)
150 runs in 30.3 overs (184 balls), Extras 8
Naeem Islam: 50 off 75 balls (8 x 4)
Drinks: 163/3 in 32.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 84, Naeem Islam 53)
4th Wicket: 150 runs in 169 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 85, Naeem Islam 61, Ex 4)
Second Power Play: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (27 runs, 2 wickets)
200 runs in 39.6 overs (241 balls), Extras 8
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 45 balls (Naeem Islam 20, Mahmudullah 24, Ex 6)
250 runs in 47.5 overs (288 balls), Extras 16
New Zealand innings
First Power Play: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (37 runs, 1 wicket)
50 runs in 12.5 overs (77 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: 60/3 in 16.3 overs (GD Elliott 26)
Rain: 82/3 in 20.0 overs (GD Elliott 28, CJ Anderson 20)
Ground Delay: 82/3 in 20.0 overs (GD Elliott 28, CJ Anderson 20)
Match reduced to 33 overs, revised target 206 runs
100 runs in 21.6 overs (132 balls), Extras 3
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 35 balls (GD Elliott 12, CJ Anderson 39, Ex 0)
GD Elliott: 50 off 65 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Rubel Hossain took a hat-trick with the wickets of Corey J Anderson (23.3), BB McCullum (23.4) & JDS Neesham (23.5)
150 runs in 28.4 overs (172 balls), Extras 3
Kane Williamson was injured while fielding and did not bat

milestones.description: Tamim Iqbal has scored 28 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 2013-14
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 2013-14: Wisden Almanack review
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 2013-14

stories.title: Injured Williamson out of Sri Lanka tour
stories.subTitle: New Zealand in Bangladesh 2013-14
stories.seoTitle: Injured Kane Williamson out of Sri Lanka tour
stories.summary: New Zealand batsman Kane Williamson has been ruled out of the ongoing ODI series in Bangladesh and the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka because of a fractured thumb

image.caption: Kane Williamson plays a pull
image.longCaption: Kane Williamson plays a pull, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 2nd Test, 3rd day, Mirpur, October 23, 2013

stories.title: Overcoming Shakib's absence was important - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Overcoming Shakib's absence was important - Mushfiqur
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mushfiqur Rahim said that the absence of Shakib Al Hasan due to illness made winning the first ODI against New Zealand imperative

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

stories.title: Rubel gets his confidence back
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Rubel Hossain gets his confidence back
stories.summary: Injuries and several underwhelming performances stood in Rubel's way in the past. Against New Zealand, the 'introvert' showed a different side to himself

image.caption: Rubel Hossain became the third Bangladesh player to take a hat-trick in ODIs
image.longCaption: Rubel Hossain became the third Bangladesh player to take a hat-trick in ODIs, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

stories.title: Rain helped, but Rubel made the difference - Anderson
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Rain helped, but Rubel made the difference - Corey Anderson
stories.summary:
New Zealand allrounder Corey Anderson has said that the rain interruption in the first ODI worked in their favour but Rubel Hossain's hat-trick
made the difference once play resumed

image.caption: Corey Anderson struck a 31-ball 46
image.longCaption: Corey Anderson struck a 31-ball 46, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

stories.title: Who called the rain?
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the first ODI between Bangladesh and New Zealand in Mirpur

image.caption: Mitchell McClenaghan runs out Mominul Haque for a diamond duck
image.longCaption: Mitchell McClenaghan runs out Mominul Haque for a diamond duck, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

stories.title: Shakib down with dengue fever, Sunny called up
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Shakib Al Hasan diagnosed with dengue fever, Elias Sunny called up
stories.summary: Shakib Al Hasan, the Bangladesh allrounder, has contracted dengue fever and will be under observation for the remainder of the ODI series against New Zealand. Shakib had missed the first ODI due to the ailment

stories.title: Rubel six-for sinks New Zealand
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Rubel Hossain's six-for sinks New Zealand
stories.summary: Rubel Hossain's six-wicket haul, including a hat-trick, turned the first ODI on its head, helping Bangladesh win by 43 runs by the Duckworth-Lewis method
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

stories.title: Death bowling, Rubel's new-ball skills put to test
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Death bowling, Rubel Hossain's new-ball skills put to test
stories.summary: Bangladesh should depend less on their spinners in the death overs and their seamers need to build their fitness to last 50 overs, says coach Shane Jurgensen

image.caption: Rubel Hossain bowls in the nets ahead of the first Test against Pakistan
image.longCaption: Rubel Hossain bowls in the nets ahead of the first Test against Pakistan, Chittagong, December 8, 2011

stories.title: Bowlers will be rotated - McCullum
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bowlers will be rotated - Brendon McCullum
stories.summary: Brendon McCullum is wary of how difficult conditions in the subcontinent can be, but believed the challenge would help his yound side grow as international cricketers

image.caption: New Zealand players train before the ODI series
image.longCaption: New Zealand players train before the ODI series, Mirpur, October 28, 2013

stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Drawn Tests give ODIs more context
stories.summary: Preview of the first ODI between Bangladesh and New Zealand in Mirpur

stories.title: '4-0 will play on New Zealand's minds' - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: '4-0 will play on New Zealand's minds' - Mushfiqur Rahim
stories.summary: Mushfiqur Rahim, the Bangladesh captain, believes their 4-0 drubbing of New Zealand in 2010 would play on the minds of the visitors ahead of their three-match ODI series

stories.title: Rain helped, but Rubel made the difference - Anderson
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Rain helped, but Rubel made the difference - Corey Anderson
stories.summary:
New Zealand allrounder Corey Anderson has said that the rain interruption in the first ODI worked in their favour but Rubel Hossain's hat-trick
made the difference once play resumed

image.caption: Corey Anderson struck a 31-ball 46
image.longCaption: Corey Anderson struck a 31-ball 46, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

recentReportStory.title: Rubel six-for sinks New Zealand
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Rubel Hossain's six-for sinks New Zealand
recentReportStory.summary: Rubel Hossain's six-wicket haul, including a hat-trick, turned the first ODI on its head, helping Bangladesh win by 43 runs by the Duckworth-Lewis method
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim attacks the off side, Bangladesh v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 29, 2013

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. He tweets here
